com.percussion.services.assembly.jexl
Class PSLocationUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSJexlUtilBase
      com.percussion.services.assembly.jexl.PSLocationUtils
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSExtension, IPSJexlExpression
public class PSLocationUtils
extends PSJexlUtilBase

Functions for use by jexl to calculate locations in assembly. Note that these functions use annotations for documentation instead of javadoc. The annotations are read by the extensions manager and presented to the workbench

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

generate

@IPSJexlMethod(description="generate a url from the parameters. The resulting url will be escaped for use in xhtml/xml.",
               params={@IPSJexlParam(name="targetItem",description="the target assembly item"),@IPSJexlParam(name="targetTemplateName",description="the target tempate\'s name"),@IPSJexlParam(name="page",description="the page number, 0 or null indicates no page")})
public String generate(IPSAssemblyItem targetItem,
                                                                                                                                          Object targetTemplate,
                                                                                                                                          Number page)
generate a url from the parameters. The resulting url will be escaped for use in xhtml/xml.

Parameters:
targetItem - the target assembly item, never null.
targetTemplate - the name, ID or the object of the target template, may not null.
page - the page number, it may be 0 or null indicate no page. This is the page number of current assembled item, which may or may not be the targetItem.
Returns:
the generated URL.

folderPath

@IPSJexlMethod(description="get Rhythmyx folder path for a given node. The resulting path is from the root to the parent of the node, but does not include the node itself. It is empty if the node does not exist or does not exist in any folder",
               params=@IPSJexlParam(name="node",type="javax.jcr.Node",description="the node to get folder path from"))
public String folderPath(Node node)
Finds the Rhythmyx virtual folder path for the given (JCR-170) node and picks the first one found (if the item/node exists in more than one folder). Note, the folder path is the path from the root to the parent folder of the node, but does not include the node itself.

Parameters:
node - the JCR-170 node or the item in question, never null.
Returns:
the requested path. It never null, but may be empty if the item does not exist or it does not exist in any folder.

path

@IPSJexlMethod(description="get Rhythmyx path for a given node. The resulting path is from the root to the node itself. It is empty if the node does not exist or does not exist in any folder",
               params=@IPSJexlParam(name="node",type="javax.jcr.Node",description="the node to get the path from"))
public String path(Node node)
Finds the Rhythmyx virtual path for the given (JCR-170) node and picks the first one found (if the item/node exists in more than one folder). Note, the path is the path from the root to the node itself.

Parameters:
node - the JCR-170 node or the item in question, never null.
Returns:
the requested path. It never null, but may be empty if the item does not exist or it does not exist in any folder.

Get the containing folder of the passed node

Parameters:
node - the node is assumed not null
Returns:
a guid of the parent folder (the first if there are multiple), or null if no parent folder is found

page - the page number of the paginated item, it may be 0 or null indicate no page.

findDefaultTemplate

public IPSAssemblyTemplate findDefaultTemplate(IPSAssemblyItem item)
                                        throws PSAssemblyException
Finds the default template for an assembly item. In order to maintain backward compatibility and ease of use, a specific process is used to determine the default template.

In general a template is default if its publishwhen attribute is set to default. i.e. template.getPublishWhen() == IPSAssemblyTemplate.PublishWhen.Default

The ideal case is if the site id is provided and there is atleast one default template associated with the site. If this is the case then a template is chosen from this set.

If the site id is not provided then a template is chosen from the set of all default templates associated with the item's content type.

If the site id is provided and there are no default templates associated with the site and assembly item's content type then an Assembly exception is thrown.

All other cases result in an assembly exception.

Parameters:
item - The assembly item
Returns:
The default template (IPSAssemblyTemplate)
Throws:
PSAssemblyException
